Posts.Content: jinan22 wrote: Dear all , For all who are ER + and taking antiestrogen.... i read in a recent article that cancer cells switch into a survival mode that normal cells also use when faced with starvation, It's called macroautophagy - autophagy means "self eating" - and within a week, breast cancer cells can reorganize component parts, degrade non-essentials and live in this state until antiestrogen therapy is stopped or the cells mutate and resume proliferation in the presence of tamoxifen. "It's like taking your foot off of the gas pedal of your car," Adding a macroautophagy inhibitor promoted robust cell death. "We believe targeting the autophagosome function will significantly improve the efficacy of hormonal treatment for estrogen-positive breast cancer," says the researcher. She recently received a three-year, $1.1 million National Cancer Institute grant to pursue that strategy. if u want to read the rest of the article .... heres the link... i didn't get the point of this way of killing cancer cells so any one here could explain more.... thanks hope all research will be useful from now on.... Medical College of Georgia (2008, October 2). Breast Cancer Cells Recycle To Escape Death By Hormonal Therapy. ScienceDaily. Retrieved October 3, 2008, from www.sciencedaily.com­ /releases/2008/10/081002103657.htm Mom dx 20/07/2008 Stage IV , mets lung and bones, ER PR + , HER2/NEU -... Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: jinan22 wrote: Hello every body, Before posting anything, i should tell that i never imagine myself posting on such a site , my mom is just 38 , young and could be the nicest person on earth , used to have problems with her back and legs .. untill we knew that these pains were convenient with a metastatic breast cancer Stage IV... my dad had stomach cancer 5 yyears ago he is NED now but who knows ...  Any way , here is the case: Stage IV with bones and lung mets Psitive estrogen progesteron still we don't know about the her2/neu .....i am the oldest one between my bro and sis , and the only one who cares they seems like pretending not to know that my mom iis on her way to death...  Tried to do the same but never able , i am not able to eat , drink nor sleep , just sitting on the net searching for any sign of hope of getting a cure for this sick cancer ... she finiched her second Taxotere chemotheraphy just now and is taking xeloda for 14 days after each chemo... The good news is that the tumor in her breast is starting to be almost invisible as her doctor is saying... is that a normal thing after chemo for the tumor to shrink after the first session or does that mean that my mom is really responding to the treatment ... her doctor said that he's gonna treat her bones lesions with laser , any body here did that ?  dunno what to say more , but beleive me i'd rather her die in an accidant than watching her dying each day taking this poisons drugs ......
